topics.title: Introduction and Background
topics.summary: Lenny introduces Nickey Skarstad, her career path (Etsy, Airbnb, The Wing, Duolingo), and what the episode will cover (vision-to-goals execution, product quality, alignment, influence).

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor reads for Mixpanel (startup analytics credits) and Dovetail (user research suite).

topics.title: How Nickey got into product at Etsy
topics.summary: Nickey shares her non-traditional entry into product: starting on Etsy’s community team, becoming an internal voice of the seller, and transitioning into an APM role that launched her PM career.

topics.title: Airbnb Experiences: marketplace complexity and PMF
topics.summary: Nickey explains why she chose Airbnb, joining Experiences right after launch as the first PM, and the unique challenge of shaping both the digital booking flow and the real-world experience.

topics.title: Operationalizing product quality with metrics and dogfooding
topics.summary: They discuss Airbnb’s quality bar, using review rate as a balancing metric, operational levers (coaching/standards), and heavy dogfooding to quickly surface real customer experience issues.

topics.title: Quality metrics beyond growth: Etsy onboarding example
topics.summary: Nickey describes how optimizing for fast shop creation hurt downstream success, leading Etsy to add onboarding friction to improve time-to-first-sale—an example of balancing growth with quality.

topics.title: Post-Airbnb roles: startup lessons, Shopify mismatch, Duolingo
topics.summary: Nickey covers moving to a co-working/community startup (and leading through layoffs during COVID), then Shopify (platform role mismatch), and finally Duolingo for a new zero-to-one challenge.

topics.title: How to know a role isn’t a fit
topics.summary: Nickey shares a practical technique: color-code meetings red/yellow/green based on energy to diagnose fit, plus advice to clarify what you love in PM work and optimize roles accordingly.

topics.title: Product org structures: functional vs GM models
topics.summary: Nickey compares functional reporting structures (good for developing PM craft at scale) with GM-led business units (useful for autonomous new bets like Airbnb Experiences), emphasizing context-dependent choices.

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor read for Unit (banking-as-a-service) and brief commentary on org structures evolving over time (e.g., Airbnb shifting models).

topics.title: Setting vision and translating it into goals
topics.summary: Nickey outlines principles for strategy work: don’t create strategy in a vacuum, bring the team along without making it a vote, and align with leadership; she uses a vision–mission–strategy–objectives pyramid to connect long-term direction to near-term OKRs.

topics.title: Decision-making, alignment, and one-way vs two-way doors
topics.summary: They discuss how to drive alignment using empathy and negotiation tactics (Chris Voss), when PMs should push vs listen, and how to categorize decisions as reversible or irreversible with examples from Airbnb standards and Etsy marketplace policy.
